title.narrative: WASH and Communication for Development for refugees and IDPs in Erbil governorate: Darashakran and Baharka camps

description.narrative: Activity 1.1.Distribute hygiene kits according to a vulnerability scale in DC Activity 1.2. Provide access to soap and other core hygiene items for the emergency affected populations in BC Activity 1.3. Promote good hygiene promotion through public awareness campaigns, educational tools and messages in BC Activity 1.4. Provide community, school and household education, sanitation and hygiene, health and nutrition promotion training and follow-up messages in DC Activity 2.1. Develop and implement participatory assessment to identify system and service gaps in DC Activity 2.2. Minor Fixing and WASH Maintenance Program (Minor Fixing) in DC Activity 2.3. Train and empower newly created community WASH committee in DC and continue to advise the existing three community committees— Hygiene, Health and Education Activity 2.4. Programme management and technical supervision Activity 3.1. Conduct water quality monitoring and testing in DC Activity 3.2. Develop and implement a handover plan to transfer the water quality monitoring responsibility to local community ownership with DC Activity 3.3. Programme management and technical supervision Activity 4.1. Develop and implement participatory assessment to identify system and service gaps Activity 4.2. Improve WASH systems, standards, and services in camp-based schools Activity 4.3. Establish school WASH committees Activity 4.4. Programme management and technical supervision

With this program, RI makes sure affected populations have improved hygiene practices through access to hygiene items as well as hygiene and sanitation, health and nutrition, and education and protection promotion activities. Community is mobilized to increase ownership of camp resources and infrastructure operation and community maintenance of WASH facilities. Affected populations have access to safe water for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene. WASH systems are reinforced in camp-based schools.And there will be camp population effective participation and involvement in management and coordination: Baharka.
